items.summary: Mexican financial authorities are close to approving an offer by billionaire Fernando Chico Pardo to buy a 25% stake in Citigroup Inc.’s Mexican retail-banking unit, Banamex, paving the way to list the business as soon as next year.

items.summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced the changes to the Financial Stability Oversight Council's mandates ahead of a meeting of the watchdog that he is scheduled to chair Thursday afternoon.

items.title: Is the falling rupee a cause for alarm?
Tejas Networks secures 7/12 BharatNet Phase III deals
items.summary: Tejas Networks is set to deploy over 50,000 routers for BharatNet Phase III. This initiative aims to upgrade rural broadband connectivity across India. The company is the largest supplier for this government program. The project will connect numerous gram panchayats and blocks with high-speed internet. This marks a significant step in expanding digital access in rural areas.

items.title: Despite the stress, big banks keep playing credit cards
items.summary: Several mid-sized lenders, including Kotak Mahindra Bank, RBL Bank, and IndusInd Bank, are slowing new credit card issuances due to ongoing sector stress and a focus on cleaning up books. This contrasts with larger banks like HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank, which continue aggressive portfolio expansion.

items.title: Kotak Bank eyes mid-market loans amid slow big-corp demand
items.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank is expanding its mid-market corporate loan book, targeting companies with ₹500 crore to ₹1,500 crore in turnover. This segment, which has grown over 35% compounded annually since its launch, is expected to see 20-25% growth over the next five years. The bank aims for this mid-market book to reach at least 20% of its total corporate portfolio.

items.title: DoT dials regulator again for suggestions on telemarketers
items.summary: The Department of Telecommunications is advocating for TRAI to expedite its recommendations concerning telemarketer regulations, a step deemed vital for the effective governance of telemarketing practices. Telecom operators are pushing for these rules to tackle the rising tide of spam calls by enhancing accountability within the industry. However, TRAI's delays are thwarting the implementation of these essential regulations.

items.title: Reliance Retail plans measured expansion, to go public in 3 years
items.summary: Reliance Retail aims for an Initial Public Offering by 2028. The company is strategically expanding its store network, adding approximately 2,000 stores annually. Debt reduction is a key focus as part of balance sheet restructuring. Reliance Retail is also enhancing its presence in the quick commerce segment. This preparation aims to improve market valuations before the planned public offering.

items.title: 'India's rice output may hit record 152 MT in 2025-26'
items.summary: India is projected to achieve a historic peak in rice production, hitting 152 million tonnes during the 2025-26 season. Meanwhile, wheat production is also on the rise. Unfortunately, the oilseed sector might face a downturn. Analysts attribute the rice boom to favorable monsoon conditions and expanded planting areas.

items.title: Russia's diamond miner Alrosa eyes India foray with a polishing facility
items.summary: Russian diamond giant Alrosa is set to establish a polishing plant in India, marking its first international expansion. The company plans to invest $50 million, aiming to boost India's position as a global manufacturing hub. Alrosa will also launch co-branded luxury jewellery lines and implement blockchain technology for supply chains.

items.title: IndiGo offers Rs 10,000 voucher to 'severely impacted' flyers in addition to refunds
items.summary: IndiGo is offering travel vouchers to customers impacted by flight cancellations and delays. With over 2,000 flights affected, the airline anticipates a hit of more than 500 crore rupees. As it recalibrates its capacity and revenue expectations, operations are gradually returning to normal following the DGCA's easing of some regulations.

items.title: Small-cap stock under  ₹50 to be in focus on Friday; here's why
items.summary: Small-cap stock under  ₹50: Hazoor Multi Projects share price will be in focus of the stock market investors on 12 December 2025, after the board approved the allotment of equity shares in conversion of share warrants. Here's how the shares have performed over time.&nbsp;

items.title: Investments in oil & gas more crucial now as green options lag: ExxonMobil
items.summary: ExxonMobil's director of economics and energy, Prasanna V Joshi, stated that investments in oil and gas production are becoming more critical as alternative solutions are not emerging as rapidly as anticipated. Capital originally planned for transition projects is being reallocated to conventional oil and gas due to market and policy challenges for low-emission technologies.

items.title: Nov. equity MF netflows rise 21% to ₹29,000 cr.

items.summary: This wedding season is set to break revenue records for hotels across India. The 'Wed in India' campaign is boosting demand for events in new hill destinations and other locations. Hotels are reporting significant increases in room revenue and bookings.

items.title: PM Modi speaks to US president Donald Trump as bilateral trade agreement talks progress
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump held a "warm and engaging" conversation, reviewing bilateral relations and discussing cooperation in critical technologies, energy, defense, and security. The leaders also touched upon ongoing trade negotiations, with both sides indicating progress in the talks.

items.title: EU FTA declaration soon: India-Italy ties get further boost; Modi invited to visit Rome
items.summary: India is enthusiastically enhancing its relationship with the European Union, with negotiations for a free trade agreement moving forward. The Republic Day celebrations are set to welcome EU leaders as prominent guests. Recently, India had the honor of hosting EU trade commissioner Maros Sefcovic and Italy's deputy prime minister Antonio Tajani, showcasing a commitment to collaboration.

items.title: India's new nuclear energy bill set to arrive with SHANTI
items.summary: India's upcoming SHANTI Bill, or Atomic Energy Bill 2025, is set to revolutionize the nuclear landscape by integrating private investment into the once-closed sphere. This initiative will not only outline a structured approach for private ventures in mineral exploration and fuel fabrication but will also secure government oversight in core areas.

items.title: Disney accuses Google of ‘massive’ copyright infringement, calls Gemini ‘virtual vending machine’
items.summary: Disney has accused Google of massive copyright infringement by using AI to exploit its images and videos. Disney sent a cease-and-desist letter demanding Google stop these actions, claiming Google falsely brands infringing images with its Gemini logo.

items.title: Italy signals deeper trade push into India as EU FTA talks near final stage
items.summary: Italy's Deputy PM Tajani announced a push for deeper trade ties with India, aiming for €700 billion in exports by 2027. Italian companies are set to expand in sectors such as automotive and pharmaceuticals, aligning with India's commitment to finalize the EU-India trade agreement.

items.title: RBI steps in to ease liquidity strain, buys Rs 50,000 crore of bonds — What it means for banks and borrowers?
items.summary: The RBI has begun injecting liquidity into the financial system with a Rs 50,000-crore bond purchase, the first of two OMOs announced last week. The step comes amid tightening liquidity caused by the central bank’s dollar sales and seasonal cash demand. With a Rs 1-trillion bond programme and a $5-billion FX swap scheduled, the RBI aims to stabilise money-market conditions, support credit flow and prevent interest rates from rising unexpectedly.

items.title: India must overcome bottlenecks to raise quantity, quality of workforce participation: NCAER report
items.summary: India faces challenges in boosting workforce quality and quantity. Skilling and small businesses are vital for job growth. Increasing the skilled workforce could create millions of jobs by 2030. Embracing digital technologies and improving credit access will significantly boost hiring. India's economic future depends on enhancing the productivity of its smallest enterprises.

items.title: US jobless benefit applicants surge to 236,000; 4.4% Americans out of work— here's what data suggests
items.summary: Americans applying for unemployment insurance benefits jumped to 236,000 for the week ending 6 December, amid layoffs and a cooling US labour market. This comes amid the US Fed cutting rates for the third time to stabilise the job market.&nbsp;

items.title: ICICI Prudential AMC IPO: Temasek, JP Morgan, other marquee anchors invest Rs 3,022 crore
items.summary: ICICI Prudential AMC raised ₹3,022 crore from 148 anchor investors, including top global funds, domestic insurers, pensions and mutual funds, signalling strong institutional confidence ahead of its ₹10,600 crore IPO opening on December 12.

items.title: RBI scraps plan to limit corporate current accounts to two big lenders
items.summary: The RBI has withdrawn its restrictive proposal on current accounts for corporate borrowers after a pushback from private banks. The revised guidelines permit banks to offer accounts based on customer requirements, aiming to balance competition and improve monitoring of borrower cash flows.

items.title: Broad-based revival in rural demand improvement in incomes: Nabard Survey
items.summary: A NABARD survey reveals a significant boost in rural economic momentum, with 80% of households reporting higher consumption over the past year. This rise in prosperity is attributed to sustained welfare support, strong public investment, GST rate rationalization, and moderating inflation, leading to improved real incomes and purchasing power.

items.title: Gold, silver to stay bullish in 2026 despite sharp swings? Report outlines what could fuel or hurt the rally
items.summary: A new Axis Mutual Fund report indicates that gold and silver may extend their strong performance into 2026, supported by safe-haven flows, central-bank buying and robust industrial demand. Gold, which has rallied nearly 60 per cent this year, is expected to retain a positive bias, although higher real yields, a stronger dollar and firmer global growth could trigger corrections. Silver’s outlook is upbeat but valuations appear stretched, raising risks of ETF outflows and sharper volatility.

items.title: Petroleum, External Affairs Ministries should work closely to further spur diversification efforts, suggest Parliamentary Committee
items.summary: The committee observed that diversification efforts are often bothered by sanctions, financial market volatility and regulatory changes in host countries.

items.title: Piyush Goyal says India left "no stone unturned" for a fair India-EU FTA talks
items.summary: India and Italy are boosting business ties. Discussions focused on a fair India-EU Free Trade Agreement. Both nations are working on expanding trade and investments. Collaboration is key in technology, innovation, and sectors like automobiles and renewable energy. Joint ventures will unlock opportunities in the EU market. This partnership is vital for future growth.

items.title: NITI calls for developing Corporate Bond Market to reduce dependency on bank led debt
items.summary: India’s corporate bond market stands at roughly $650 billion, whereas the United Kingdom—an economy smaller than India in GDP ranking—has a corporate bond market exceeding $4 trillion, nearly six times larger.

Top F&B players like Haldiram’s, CAFS, ISKON and Sarovar Portico have been brought into the supply chain to provide fresh, hygienic food prepared in professional kitchens.

items.title: IndiGo Crisis: Key takeaways from the 2-hour high-level meet as CEO submits recovery plan
items.summary: IndiGo’s crisis-review meeting with the government ended after two hours, with the CEO presenting a recovery plan aimed at restoring stability. IndiGo has scaled down operations to just over 1,950 flights daily, assured that spot cancellations have stopped, confirmed that international routes remain unaffected, and submitted detailed updates on refunds, baggage and compensation. A revised schedule for the coming days has also been shared, signalling a move from crisis management to stabilisation.

items.title: RBI eases restrictions on cash credit accounts, eases current account norms

Additionally, the central bank eased norms for current and overdraft accounts, allowing banks to maintain them without restriction for customers with exposures under 100 million rupees.

items.title: Budweiser ties up with ICC in AB InBev's first cricket outing with a 2-year sponsorship contract
items.summary: Budweiser will be the official sponsor for ICC's tournaments for the next two years. This is the first association with cricket for the world's largest beer maker.

items.summary: The Securities Appellate Tribunal has temporarily halted a Sebi order preventing Prabhudas Lilladher from new business for seven days. Sebi has six weeks to reply to the appeal, with the next hearing slated for March 23, 2026.

items.title: Jindal Steel triples heat-treated plate capacity to 7 lakh tonnes annually
items.summary: Jindal Steel & Power has significantly expanded its heat-treated plate capacity. The company's annual capacity has tripled to seven lakh tonnes. This move strengthens its offerings in high-strength, abrasion-resistant, and defense-grade plates. The enhanced capabilities support India's manufacturing goals and export potential. Jindal Steel also plans infrastructure development to improve its supply chain efficiency.

items.title: New RBI rules for current accounts from April 1, 2026 — Key changes explained
items.summary: The RBI has introduced a stricter current account framework effective from 1 April 2026, tightening controls for businesses with borrowing of Rs 10 crore or more. Only lenders holding at least 10% of total exposure may operate full current accounts, while others can maintain only restricted collection accounts. Funds in such accounts must be transferred within two working days, and facilities such as withdrawal, cheques and cards will not be allowed. Banks must review accounts every six months, flag them in core systems and take action within defined timelines if rules are breached.

items.title: Prada to source collection of sandals, inspired by Kolhapuri Chappals from LIDCOM, LIDKAR

items.title: India's wealth creation hits 30-year peak in 2020–25; Rs 148 trillion added by top firms: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to the report, the world is getting wealthier and so is India, with global financial assets compounding steadily and India's market cap compounding at 17 per cent over the last 20 years. India's GDP quadrupled from $1 trillion to $4 trillion in the last 17 years, and the study projects another quadrupling in the next 17 years, driving a multi-trillion dollar (MTD) opportunity across sectors.

items.title: BSE, RVNL to Adani Power: These 10 stocks are fastest wealth creators in last 5 years, shows MOSL study

items.title: IndiGo boss Pieter Elbers asked to appear before DGCA on December 12
items.summary: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers has been summoned by the DGCA on December 12, 2025, to address severe operational disruptions, including widespread flight cancellations and crew issues. The airline's pilot strength has significantly dropped, prompting the DGCA to deploy officers to its headquarters to monitor operations amid criticism from pilots' bodies regarding the airline's manpower strategy.

items.title: Amazon expands India push with Govt tie-ups for artisans, women-led enterprises and more — full details
items.summary: Amazon Inc. partners with government institutions to uplift traditional artisans and women-led startups, aiming to enhance market access and sustainability. This collaboration promises significant job creation, reinforcing Amazon's commitment to India's economic development, the company said.

items.title: SME IPO: Pajson Agro India IPO fully subscribed on Day 1 on strong demand from institutional investors
items.summary: The Pajson Agro India IPO attracted strong institutional interest, achieving a 1.08 times subscription on Day 1. The company seeks to raise  ₹74.45 crore. The IPO price is set at  ₹112-118 per share, with a listing expected on December 18.

items.title: 'Never negotiate with deadlines as you can make mistakes': Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talks
items.summary: India's trade talks with the United States are moving forward positively. Union Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Deputy Trade Representative Rick Switzer. Discussions have been substantive over multiple rounds. Switzer's visit marks his first trip to India. Goyal emphasized that any agreement must benefit both countries. He also noted that setting deadlines can lead to errors in negotiations.

items.title: HUDCO raises Rs 1,905 crore at 6.98% amidst volatile bond market
items.summary: HUDCO raised ₹1,905 crore via a 7-year bond at a 6.98% coupon despite rising yields and market volatility, securing funding below secondary market levels, reflecting its strong credit profile, investor confidence and disciplined liability management.

items.title: Rupee falls by 40 paise to close at record low of 90.37 vs dollar
items.summary: The rupee opened at 89.95 in the interbank market but kept losing ground. It fell to a record intra-day low of 90.48, marking a 51-paise drop from the previous close.

items.title: GCC surge to reshape India’s IT and office leasing market as revenue hits $64.6 billion
items.summary: India's Global Capability Centres are growing rapidly, moving beyond back-office tasks to become innovation hubs. This trend is boosting the country's IT sector and increasing demand for prime office spaces. GCCs are employing more professionals and are projected to significantly contribute to office leasing. Government policies are supporting this expansion, making India a key destination for global tech operations.

items.title: Taj GVK set for a sharp rally? Analyst bullish on hotel stock with Rs 470 target
items.summary: Stock To Buy: Analyst have turned bullish on Taj GVK as the hotel operator benefits from a strong tourism revival, robust demand in Hyderabad and favourable valuations after a sharp correction. Market expert Sandeep Jain has set a target of ₹470 for the stock, citing steady growth, healthy financials and improving sector fundamentals. With a P/E of 19, ROE of 17 per cent and profits rising over 112 per cent in three years, the counter is being viewed as an attractive medium- to long-term pick.

items.title: Oman's lower house approves trade pact with India; Union cabinet may take up on Fri
items.summary: India's free trade agreement with Oman is moving forward. Oman's Shura Council has approved the pact. India's Union Cabinet is expected to review it soon. This agreement aims to boost trade in goods and services. It will reduce or eliminate customs duties on many products. India's exports to Oman are set to benefit significantly.

items.title: Watch: Indian rice exporters not worried about US’s high tariff threats
items.summary: Indian rice exporters remain unfazed after the United States threatened to impose higher tariffs on Indian rice. Exporters say the move is unlikely to affect their business, as shipments to the US make up only a tiny fraction of India’s overall rice exports. However, rice growers in Haryana feel that higher tariff by US would make them competitive weaker in the global market at a time when farmers in any case were facing a lot of problems.

items.title: India’s beverage carton recycling jumps to 48%, beats global average
items.summary: A recent study shows India's recycling rate for food and beverage cartons has risen to 48%, significantly higher than the global average of 27%. This achievement results from combined efforts in sustainability, education, and innovative technology in the recycling sector.

items.title: Vodafone Idea and 4 other stocks hit 52-week highs; gains up to 20% in a month
items.summary: Five BSE 500 stocks—including Vodafone Idea, Esab India and Eicher Motors—hit fresh 52-week highs on Thursday, logging monthly gains of up to 20% despite a weak broader market.

items.title: Finance Ministry streamlines recruitment, result cycle for public sector banks
items.summary: This includes recruitment to SBI, Nationalised Banks and Regional Rural Banks

items.title: India’s first indigenous hydrogen fuel cell passenger vessel enters commercial service in Varanasi
items.summary: India's first indigenous hydrogen fuel cell passenger vessel has commenced commercial operations in Varanasi, marking a significant step in sustainable maritime transport. This vessel, powered by a Low Temperature Proton Exchange Membrane fuel cell system, releases only water as a byproduct, contributing to the rejuvenation of the Ganga River.

items.title: IndiGo flight crisis: DGCA officials start monitoring operations, refunds at airline headquarters
items.summary: DGCA officials are now monitoring IndiGo's operations directly from its headquarters. This move follows significant flight cancellations due to planning failures. The regulator is scrutinizing cancellations, crew deployment, and passenger refunds. On-site inspections at airports are also underway. IndiGo, a major airline, has cancelled thousands of flights, impacting many passengers. The airline states its operations are stabilizing.

items.title: Eastman Auto and Power files confidential IPO papers
items.summary: Eastman Auto and Power Ltd, an energy-transition and power-electronics company, has filed confidential IPO papers with markets regulator Sebi to raise funds, with people familiar with the matter estimating the issue size at Rs 1,800-2,000 crore.

items.title: How do SIPs convert market swings into long-term wealth creation?
items.summary: SIPs allow an investor to accrue substantial savings over time, which, when compounded, can create wealth. Great returns result from a strong investment process, and SIPs provide the ideal platform for one.

items.summary: Motilal Oswal forecasts India’s GDP rising from $4 trillion to over $16 trillion by 2042, driving a major wealth-creation cycle. It has created a 30-stock equal-weighted portfolio positioned to benefit from rising incomes, higher savings, strong credit growth, infrastructure expansion and long-term structural demand across autos, financials, capital goods, healthcare, real estate, telecom and capital markets.

items.title: Airtel leads as India's stock market creates Rs 148 lakh crore wealth in 5 years: Motilal Oswal study
items.summary: India’s stock market created a record Rs 148 lakh crore in wealth between 2020 and 2025, with the top 100 wealth creators delivering 38% CAGR—its strongest cycle ever, according to Motilal Oswal. Bharti Airtel, ICICI Bank, BSE, and HAL topped categories across the biggest, fastest, and most consistent performers during this structural rally.

Budweiser 0.0 will lead the activation in India, with other AB InBev brands engaging fans globally. The court asked why such a situation was allowed to escalate into nationwide unrest, leaving lakhs of passengers stranded and causing huge losses to the national economy.

items.title: What the IndiGo fiasco tells us: The role played by the state is being taken over by mega corporations

items.summary: The Sensex closed 427 points, or 0.51%, higher at 84,818.13, while the Nifty 50 settled at 25,898.55, up 141 points, or 0.55%. As the BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices also rose by 0.79% and 0.51%, respectively.

The government anticipates crossing the $100 billion FDI mark this fiscal year, a crucial development amid investor outflows.

The brokerage is bullish on Consumer Discretionary, Industrials, Healthcare and Materials, while remaining cautious on Financials, Staples, IT and Telecom. With liquidity support from the RBI, rural revival and steady domestic flows, Emkay sees a multi-year growth cycle ahead, with SMIDs positioned to outperform despite elevated valuations.

items.summary: The Federal Reserve delivered another rate cut but signalled a likely pause as policymakers await clearer labour and inflation data. Despite internal divisions, new projections show steady growth, easing inflation, and stable unemployment through 2026, though limited support for further easing. Market reaction remained positive, even as political scrutiny intensifies ahead of the US midterm elections.

items.title: Market lacks clear direction; largecaps favoured, AI wave poses risks to IT: Anand Tandon
items.summary: Independent analyst Anand Tandon says Indian markets remain directionless amid global macro risks, weak foreign investor returns, and uncertain earnings. He prefers largecaps over smallcaps, citing stronger positioning in metals, energy and AI-driven themes. Tandon warns that AI adoption poses long-term challenges for Indian IT’s traditional services model, making the sector structurally vulnerable despite near-term margin support.

items.title: Old economy sectors drive India's investment boom unlike US, position it as an AI hedge: Report
items.summary: The report noted that, unlike the US, where a sharp rise in spending on IT equipment and software is now dominating private investment, India’s capex story continues to be broad-based and rooted in traditional sectors

items.title: Fed signals economic stability as US heads towards 2026 midterms
items.summary: The Fed’s latest projections indicate faster growth, easing inflation and stable employment heading into 2026, offering the White House a supportive economic backdrop despite limited scope for deeper rate cuts. While tariff-driven disruptions and affordability pressures persist, policymakers project cautious stability as the election cycle approaches.

items.title: Divided U.S. Fed makes third straight rate cut, signals higher bar ahead
items.summary: The Fed’s statement on its decision also brought back language used in late-2024 to signal a pause in more rate cuts

items.title: AU Small Finance among 6 F&O stocks that saw sharp rise in futures open interest
Sensex jumps over 50 points, Nifty above 25,750 after US Fed rate cut
items.summary: Indian equities opened higher on Thursday, with both the Sensex and Nifty reversing a three-day decline. This uptick followed the U.S. Federal Reserve's expected 25-basis-point rate cut, a move anticipated to curb foreign investor outflows from the Indian market.

items.title: India's pension funds warn proposed bond rules may distort values
items.summary: Indian pension fund executives are pushing back against a regulatory framework designed to shield the $175 billion sector from fluctuations in the bond market. This proposed shift in valuing specific bond assets has sparked concern among managers, who argue it risks misrepresenting fund worth and complicating investor decisions.

items.title: Park Medi World IPO Day 2: GMP slips to 9%; check subscription status, review and key highlights
items.summary: Park Medi World IPO: The issue is commanding a grey market premium of ₹14, or roughly 9% above its ₹162 issue price, hinting at a possible listing around ₹183–184. The premium has eased from about 13% earlier, indicating a mild dip in grey market interest.

items.title: Fed resumes balance-sheet expansion to ease repo market liquidity strains
items.summary: The Federal Reserve is resuming Treasury bill purchases to ease liquidity strains in US money markets, responding to rising repo rates and tightened funding conditions. The move aims to stabilise short-term markets, maintain control over interest rates, and prevent year-end volatility.

items.title: Adani Enterprises shares in focus as Rs 25,000-crore rights issue ends oversubscribed
items.summary: Adani Enterprises shares: Adani Enterprises’ ₹25,000-crore rights issue closed with strong demand, ending 108% subscribed. The public portion saw even higher interest at 130%, while promoters fully subscribed to their entitlements—signalling broad investor confidence in the company’s fundraising effort.

items.title: Coca-Cola appoints Henrique Braun as next CEO, James Quincey becomes executive chairman
items.summary: Braun, 57, has over three decades of experience at Coke, having led operations across Latin America, Greater China, and South Korea, and managed supply chain, marketing, innovation, and bottling operations.

items.title: US Fed delivers 3rd rate cut in a row. What does it mean for Indian stock market?
items.summary: The US Federal Reserve cut the federal funds rate by 25 basis points to 3.50–3.75% on December 11, marking its third consecutive reduction. While the Fed signalled only one more cut in 2026, market expectations diverge, with CME FedWatch data showing a 77% probability of two additional reductions. Uncertainty persists over the policy outlook and its global impact.

items.title: Eternal shares tumble 21% from October peaks. Can investors buy this dip?
items.summary: Eternal, India’s largest quick-commerce player, has slipped 21% from its October peak, falling in 24 of 37 sessions after Q2 results triggered sustained selling. Analysts say fundamentals remain solid, but technical indicators show continued pressure with no confirmed reversal. Traders are watching key support zones to assess whether the correction opens an entry opportunity or if more downside remains.

items.title: Google for Startups Hub launches in Hyderabad's T-Hub: Free spaces for a year, training for founders — What's inside?
items.summary: The dedicated Google-branded space in Hyderabad will house scores of new startups, becoming the first Google for Startups Hub set up by the tech giant as part of Telangana’s broader incubation and innovation ecosystem.

items.title: KSH International to launch Rs 710 crore IPO on December 16. Check price band, issue size, other details
items.summary: KSH International is set to open its Rs 710-crore IPO on December 18 at a price band of Rs 365–384 per share, combining a Rs 420-crore fresh issue with a Rs 290-crore offer-for-sale. Backed by SEBI’s August approval and a revised offer size, the magnet winding wire maker plans to use the proceeds for debt repayment, machinery expansion at its Supa and Chakan plants, and a rooftop solar project. The anchor book opens on December 15, allotment is due on December 19, and trading will begin on December 23.

items.title: Vijay Kedia doubles money in 1 year, but this time investment isn't in a hidden smallcap stock
items.summary: Ace investor Vijay Kedia has doubled his money in a year—not through a smallcap multibagger, but via a silver ETF as the metal hit record highs. Despite the windfall, he’s keeping his precious metals allocation limited, citing long historical cycles of underperformance. Silver’s rally, driven by supply deficits and rising industrial demand, marks a rare shift in Kedia’s stock-focused strategy.

items.title: IndiGo flight status today: Check IndiGo cancelled flights at major Indian airports on December 11
items.summary: IndiGo flights cancelled status: On Thursday, IndiGo flights were cancelled at the Goa and Chennai Airports as the crisis continued for the tenth consecutive day. IndiGo cancelled multiple flights at the Ahmedabad and Bengaluru airports on Thursday too. Seven flights were cancelled at the Goa airport today and 36 at the Chennai airport. The crisis-hit airline has also announced travel vouchers worth Rs 10,000 to severely impacted customers between December 3 to December 5

items.title: Lloyds Metals & Energy among 5 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.summary: Five Nifty500 stocks showed strengthening momentum on December 10 as their RSI crossed above 50, signalling early accumulation and improving trend bias. items.title: "Damaging India, Hurting America": US Representative sounds alarm on Trump's tariff, immigration policy

Additionally, US representatives express unease regarding India's close ties with Russia and China. H-1B visa fees are also discussed as a point of contention. Efforts are underway to strengthen the US-India partnership.

items.title: Mexico approves tariff hikes on imports from India, China, and other Asian countries

This move, aimed at strengthening domestic industries, will impact goods like autos, textiles, and steel from countries without trade agreements. Business groups and affected governments have voiced their opposition to the new duties.

items.title: Daily average train services rise to 11,740 post-Covid-19 rationalisation from pre-pandemic level of 11,283 daily trains

A sleeper version of the Vande Bharat train is being developed with advanced safety features. Two such rakes are currently undergoing trials. This development aims to enhance passenger travel and safety across the network.

While progress is noted, some resistance exists regarding specific agricultural products and meats. Both nations aim to finalize the initial phase of the agreement, with trade experts advising caution on agricultural concessions.

items.title: Oracle Posts Weak Cloud Sales, Raising Fear of Delayed Payoff

A US team is currently in New Delhi for discussions. Negotiations with Chile and Oman are also nearing completion. India is also pursuing trade pacts with Qatar and Israel.

items.title: Watch: How is India responding to calls for shipping decarbonisation?

These rules are a result of consensus arrived at carefully, with much expert input, through meetings that are not dramatic. But in October, when the IMO that has 176 member-nations met to vote on decarbonising global shipping as a response to climate change, the U.S. actively disrupted the meeting. Chaos ruled. items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
